alert.note: Alert for City and Borough of Juneau (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 2:19PM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...A Strong Storm Moves Through the Panhandle This Weekend... A gale force low with a significant source of subtropical moisture will enter the Gulf of Alaska Saturday. This system will bring moderate to heavy rain and windy conditions to the Panhandle Saturday and Sunday. Heaviest rainfall is expected through Saturday afternoon with the central inner channels and southern Panhandle seeing the greatest accumulations. For those along the Mendenhall River, the rainy and windy conditions could increase the risk of trees falling into and around the river from the already unstable river banks. Current best estimates suggest that there is a greater than 70 percent chance that the southern Panhandle could see at least 3 inches of rainfall over 48 hours. For the northern and central gulf coast and central inner channels, there is around a 50 percent chance of at least 2 inches of rain could fall over 48 hours. Winds will increase through Saturday before diminishing Sunday. Strongest winds are expected Saturday afternoon through Saturday evening. 30 to 40 kt marine winds are expected to arrive to outer coast by late Saturday morning. Through the inner channels, first estimates suggest marine winds between 20 to 30 kts are likely through Saturday afternoon. For central and southern Panhandle communities, wind gusts to 35 mph are likely.
